listPlace.head: List of places mentioned in Lili Elbe Digital Archive

place.note: The Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts (Det Kongelige Danske Kunstakademi) in Copenhagen, Denmark.

A region of the Czech Republic

An ancient Roman city near modern Naples in the Campania region of Italy
The square in front of the town hall in Copenhagen

listPerson.head: List of people mentioned in Lili Elbe Digital Archive

person.note: Daughter of Hélène Allatini and Eric Moïse Allatini
Andreas Sparre's unnamed brother in narrative
Andreas Sparre's unnamed brothers in narrative
Italian soldier; mentioned in Allatini's memoir
Andreas Sparre's unnamed cousin in narrative; historical figure not identified

Danish art dealer who exhibited Einar's and Gerda's work
Not mentioned in A1; name of Sparres' dog in narrative and name of Einar's and Gerda's dog
Hjalmar was the fictious name first used for Niels Hvide
Not mentioned in D1; Norweigan writer and activist
Factotum of a hotel mentioned in the narrative
Lilimoe is a nickname given to Herta Keller's husband in German Letter 2
Lili's friend; mentioned in Danish letters, but identity is unknown
Modeled on Anna Larssen, a Danish actress
Unable to verify that Lili Elbe used the pseudonym Lili Courtaud outside of its use in the narrative
Not mentioned in G1; religious reference
German literary agent, author and translator
French author nominated for the Nobel prize in literature
Modeled on Margarete Leifert, or possibly Seifert, a nurse at the Dresden clinic

Italian general; mentioned in Allatini's memoir
Modeled on Ruth Hanna Harthern-Thaning, Ernst Harthern's daughter
Andreas Sparre's sister in narrative; modeled on Christiane Wegener Thomsen, Einar's sister
Danish diplomat; mentioned in Allatini's memoir
Modeled on Léon Leyritz, French sculptor
